casebody.data:
JAMES OFFICER, Plaintiff and Respondent, v. JOHN J. BURCHELL, Impld., &c., Defendant and Appellant.

Before Curtis, Ch. J., and Sedgwick and Freedman, JJ.

Decided January 6, 1879. Appeal by the defendant Burchell, from so much of the judgment in foreclosure as charges him with deficiency. (Jharles A. JaeJcson, for appellant. William McDermott, for respondent.

The case involves only questions of fact.

Curtis, Ch. J., wrote for affirmance, with costs.

Sedgwick and Freedman, JJ., concurred.
